trans-unit.source: Encapsulates the information needed when creating a control.
The information in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams> can be used to pass information about the initial state and appearance of a control.

Most <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> derived controls override the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateParams%2A> property to pass in the appropriate values or include additional information in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams>.

For more information about creating control parameters, see the `CreateWindow` and `CreateWindowEx` functions and the `CREATESTRUCT` structure documentation in the Windows Platform SDK reference located in the MSDN Library.

The constants used to set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams.Style%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams.ExStyle%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams.ClassStyle%2A> properties are defined in the Winuser.h header file.
This file is installed by the Platform SDK or Visual Studio.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the control's initial text.
The control's initial text.
Gets or sets the name of the Windows class to derive the control from.
The default value for this property is `null`, indicating that the control is not derived from an existing control class.
To derive from an existing control class, store the system class name in this property.
For example, to derive from the standard <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> control, set this property to "BUTTON".
The name of the Windows class to derive the control from.
Gets or sets a bitwise combination of class style values.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams.ClassStyle%2A> property is ignored if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams.ClassName%2A> property is not `null`.

For more information about creating control parameters, see the `CreateWindow` and `CreateWindowEx` functions and the `CREATESTRUCT` structure documentation in the Windows Platform SDK reference located in the MSDN Library.

The constants used to set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams.Style%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams.ExStyle%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams.ClassStyle%2A> properties are defined in the Winuser.h header file.
This file is installed by the Platform SDK or Visual Studio.
A bitwise combination of the class style values.
Gets or sets a bitwise combination of extended window style values.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams.ExStyle%2A> property supports extended appearance and initial state values to apply to the control.

For more information about creating control parameters, see the `CreateWindow` and `CreateWindowEx` functions and the `CREATESTRUCT` structure documentation in the Windows Platform SDK reference located in the MSDN Library.

The constants used to set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams.Style%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams.ExStyle%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams.ClassStyle%2A> properties are defined in the Winuser.h header file.
This file is installed by the Platform SDK or Visual Studio.
A bitwise combination of the extended window style values.
Gets or sets the initial height of the control.
The numeric value that represents the initial height of the control.
Gets or sets additional parameter information needed to create the control.
If you are creating a multiple document interface (MDI) client window, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams.Param%2A> property must reference a `CLIENTCREATESTRUCT` structure.

For more information about creating control parameters, see the `CreateWindow` and `CreateWindowEx` functions and the `CLIENTCREATESTRUCT` structure documentation in the Windows Platform SDK reference located in the MSDN Library.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that holds additional parameter information needed to create the control.
Gets or sets the control's parent.
An <xref href="System.IntPtr"></xref> that contains the window handle of the control's parent.
Gets or sets a bitwise combination of window style values.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams.Style%2A> property controls the appearance of the control and its initial state.

For more information about creating control parameters, see the `CreateWindow` and `CreateWindowEx` functions and the `CREATESTRUCT` structure documentation in the Windows Platform SDK reference located in the MSDN Library.

The constants used to set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams.Style%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams.ExStyle%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams.ClassStyle%2A> properties are defined in the Winuser.h header file.
This file is installed by the Platform SDK or Visual Studio.
A bitwise combination of the window style values.
Returns a string that represents the current object.
A string that represents the current object.
Gets or sets the initial width of the control.
The numeric value that represents the initial width of the control.
Gets or sets the initial left position of the control.
The numeric value that represents the initial left position of the control.
Gets or sets the top position of the initial location of the control.
The numeric value that represents the top position of the initial location of the control.
